| What does this do? | **This policy is in Report Only mode. Before enabaling, consider excluding break glass accounts and account for any guest users in the tenant. This must be enabled to be compilant** Blocks the OAuth2 device code authentication flow via Conditional Access, preventing devices that rely on browser-based approval on another device from obtaining tokens. |
| Why should you use this? | Mitigates device-code phishing attacks. Blocking this flow reduces that attack surface. |
| What is the end-user impact? | Users of input constrained devices that rely on the device code flow will be unable to authenticate using that method; administrators may need to allow or manage a small set of trusted devices or provide alternative onboarding paths. |
| Learn more | [Device code flow (OAuth 2.0)](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/entra/identity-platform/v2-oauth2-device-code) [Authentication flows (Conditional Access)](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/entra/identity/conditional-access/concept-authentication-flows) |
